title: Green Springs: Park Home
body: A Tapestry of Rural Landscapes and Architecture  Green Springs National Historic Landmark District in Virginiaâ€™s Piedmont encompasses over 14,000 acres. Its farmsteads offer a continuum of rural vernacular architecture in original context with minimal alteration. Landscapes and buildings, many predating the Civil War and connected to one another visually and through family relationships of early occupants, are today preserved through easements.                Stories   Explore the stories of historic Green Springs         Places   Explore the historic places associated with Green Springs
